Type.Name: GMD/GFD
Type.Description: **GMD** is the model format used by Atlus in Persona 5 and the P3/4/5 Dancing games. The textures are headerless ``DDS`` images, and animations are stored separately as **GAP** files.

Type.Name: CVM
Type.Description: A **CVM** is an archive format developed by Criware and used in Persona 3 and 4 (PS2). It is based on ISO9660 so its contents can be extracted by several ISO editing programs (or even 7zip). To modify the contents of a CVM, you should use [TGE's Mod Compendium](https://shrinefox.github.io/guides/p3-p4/mod-compendium). Alternatively, you could also use [PersonaPatcher](https://shrinefox.github.io/guides/p3-p4/personapatcher).

Type.Name: mod.cpk
Type.Description: A **mod.cpk** file is a prepackaged archive that the game can load mods from. The files inside override the contents loaded from the game's other CPK files.

Type.Name: TMX
Type.Description: A **TMX** is an Atlus image format used in all versions of Persona 3 and 4 (as well as SMT: Nocturne). Images can range from 16 colors to 256 colors with alpha transparency. TMX is used for character bustups, HUDs, and logos. Sometimes these files are wrapped in ``SPR`` containers or ``PAC/BIN`` archives.

Type.Name: SPR
Type.Description: A **SPR** is an Atlus archive format used in all versions of Persona 3, 4 and 5. SPRs can contain several images. Usually, HUD graphics are contained in SPRs along with sprite coordinates. These properties can be edited using ``SPRAtlasEditor``.

Type.Name: FNT
Type.Description: **FNT** is a compressed bitmap image format used in all versions of Persona 3, 4 and 5 (as well as SMT:Nocturne). It is used to store a spritesheet of the game's main font. The ``PersonaFont`` program can compress and decompress the bitmap, as well as edit the coordinates and spacing.

Type.Name: GAP
Type.Description: **GAP** is an Atlus animation format used in Persona 5 as well as the Dancing games. It is used along with ``GMD``. You can view these animations using the GMD maxscript in 3dsmax.

Type.Name: RMD
Type.Description: **RMD** is RenderWare's model format used in Persona 3 and 4 (PS2). RMD files contain textures, animations, and geometries. Sometimes they are stored in ``PAC/BIN`` archives along with ``ACX`` files to pair the models with voice clips. You can use ``Amicitia`` to export the model data as ``DAE`` or replace it using an ``FBX`` (ASCII 2011). The replacement FBX has to use the same exact bone hierarchy as the original. You can use the RMD maxscript to import the models, textures and animations into 3dsmax.

Page.Name: Persona 3 and 4 Rigging Custom Models Tutorial

Type.Name: GMO
Type.Description: **GMO** is a model format used in Persona 3 Portable and Persona 4 Golden. GMO files can be previewed and exported using Noesis. In P4G, GMO files are contained within AMD archives, which can be opened and extracted with ``Amicitia``.

Page.Name: Persona 3 and 4 Rigging Custom Models Tutorial

Type.Name: PAC
Type.Description: **PAC** (sometimes named PAK or BIN) is an Atlus archive format used in all Persona titles. PAC files can be opened with ``Amicitia`` which can also extract, preview and replace the contents. There's also a commandline PAC tool in TGE's ``PackTools``.

Type.Name: ADX
Type.Description: **ADX** is a Criware audio format used in most Persona games. ADX files can be played back using the [vgmstream library](https://www.hcs64.com/vgmstream.html) for [foobar2000](https://www.foobar2000.org/). New ADX files can be created several ways, the easiest currently being ``AtomENCD`` for looping BGM, and ``PES Sound Converter`` for batch converting non-looping sounds.

Type.Name: ACX
Type.Description: **ACX** is an archive format used in Persona 3 and 4 (PS2). ACX contains ``ADX`` files. ``Amicitia`` can extract and replace the contents of an ACX. There's also a commandline ACX tool included in TGE's ``PackTools``.

Type.Name: AFS
Type.Description: **AFS** is an archive format used in Persona 3 and 4 (PS2) as well as Persona 3 Portable. AFS is used to contain non-looping ``ADX`` voice clips. ``PuyoTools`` can extract them and create new AFS files. New AFS archives need to be ``Version 2`` and their Block Size needs to be ``2048``.

Type.Name: CPK
Type.Description: **CPK** is a archive format developed by Criware. It's used in P3P, P4G, P5, PQ and P4D to store all of the game's files. You can use either [CriPakGUI](https://shrinefox.github.io/tools/p5#cripaktools) or [QuickBMS](http://aluigi.altervista.org/quickbms.htm) (with the [CPK script](https://puu.sh/mNBEk/3cc2def391.bms)) to extract the contents of a CPK. To repack a CPK for P5, just use [CriPackedFileMaker](https://shrinefox.github.io/tools/p5#cripackedfilemaker). For all other games, you must use compression on specific files to avoid crashes. Use the [CpkFileListDumper](http://www.mediafire.com/file/7yy1vu4n1ybenbj/CpkFilelistDumper.7z) to generate a CSV from your original CPK and use it to repack. More info can be found in the guide below.

Type.Name: AWB
Type.Description: **AWB** is a Criware archive format used in Persona 4 Golden, Persona 5, and the Dancing games, usually containing voice clips and background music. ``SonicAudioTools' ACBEditor`` can extract from them and replace the contents, given they are paired with an ``ACB`` file.

Type.Name: AtlusGfdEditor
Type.Description: **AtlusGfdEditor** is a Windows application developed by **TGE**. It supports viewing, importing, and modifying models, textures and materials in **GFS**/**GMD** format.

Type.Name: BF
Type.Description: **BF** is the binary output of a scripting format used in most Atlus games. It often provides the logic for enemy AI and NPC interaction in the field. TGE's ``AtlusScriptCompiler`` program can decompile BF files back into a scripting language (.flow) that you can edit and recompile. BF files can sometimes contain ``BMD`` files (containing dialog text), which also get converted for editing by the program automatically.

Type.keywords: bmd, msg, msgscript, messagescript, message script
Type.Name: BMD
Type.Description: **BMD** is a text format used in most Atlus games. It is most frequently used for dialog, response options and menus. It also supports displaying bustups, changing text color or playing back voice clips. TGE's ``AtlusScriptCompiler`` program can decompile BMD files back into an easy-to-edit format (.msg). ``BF`` files can sometimes contain BMDs, which also get converted for editing by the program automatically.

Type.Name: PM1
Type.Description: **PM1** is an archive format used in Persona 3 and 4. It is most frequently used to store event dialog. TGE's ``PM1MessageScriptEditor`` program can decompile the text into an easy-to-edit format (.msg) and also convert it back.

Type.Name: ELF
Type.Description: **ELF** (executable and linkable format) files are the main binary used to launch and run a game. Anything programmed within one is considered to be a \"hardcoded\" function of the game. In Persona 3 and 4 for the PS2, the ELF is contained in a file starting with \"**SLUS**\" at the root of the ``ISO``. The offsets of all the files are hardcoded and must be updated using TGE's [PersonaPatcher](https://shrinefox.github.io/tools/p3-p4#personapatcher) when creating new ``CVM`` files. In all other Persona titles, it is in an **EBOOT** file at the root of the game. TGE's [RPCS3PatchEboot](https://shrinefox.github.io/tools/p5#eboot-patch) program can apply patches from a ``patch.yml`` file to a Persona 5 EBOOT.

Type.Name: patch.yml
Type.Description: **patch.yml** is a text file that you can use to modify executable code of a PS3 game using ``RPCS3``. It goes in the root of the emulator's installation directory and uses a PPU hash to apply changes to the executable. TGE's [RPCS3PatchEboot](https://shrinefox.github.io/tools/p5#eboot-patch) program can apply patches from a patch.yml file to a Persona 5 EBOOT for use on modded consoles.

Type.Name: pnach
Type.Description: **pnach** is a file containing cheat codes that you can use with ``PCSX2``. A pnach file must be named after your game's CRC and goes in your Documents/PCSX2/cheats folder.

Type.Name: Amicitia
Type.Description: **Amicitia** (latin for _friendship_) is a Windows application developed by **TGE**. It supports editing a large variety of formats used in Atlus games, such as ``TMX``, ``PAC``, ``SPR`` and ``RMD``. It can even convert custom models to the ``RMD`` format used by Persona 3 and 4 (PS2). You need [Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6.1](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49981) installed to launch it, and a videocard supporting at least version 4.0 of OpenGL to preview ``RMD`` models.

Type.Name: Mod Compendium
Type.Description: The mod compendium is a program used to create, combine and install mods for Persona 3 and 4 (PS2) and Persona 5 (PS3).
